newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile March inflation sharply lower from year ago.
newsitem.headline: Chile March inflation sharply lower from year ago.

text.p: Chilean consumer prices rose 0.3 percent in March against a 0.7 percent increase in the same month last year, said the National Statistics Institute.
March's figure brings the rise in consumer prices in the first three months to 1.7 percent compared with 1.5 percent in the same period 1996.
Consumer prices have increased 6.8 percent in the 12 months to March, down from 7.9 percent in the year ending March 1996.
Food and clothing prices fell 0.4 percent last month, housing costs remained unchanged, while transport and communications prices rose 0.2 percent. The miscellaneous category increased 2.3 percent.
The government will issue February industrial production and unemployment figures for the December-February quarter later this week.
